import MethodEndpoint from "@theme/ApiExplorer/MethodEndpoint";
import ParamsDetails from "@theme/ParamsDetails";
import RequestSchema from "@theme/RequestSchema";
import StatusCodes from "@theme/StatusCodes";
import OperationTabs from "@theme/OperationTabs";

<Heading
  as={"h1"}
  className={"openapi__heading"}
  children={"Get supplier by ID (POST)"}
>
</Heading>

<MethodEndpoint
  method={"post"}
  path={"/api/v1.0/suppliers/{supplierId}"}
  context={"endpoint"}
>
  
</MethodEndpoint>



Retrieves a single supplier record by its unique identifier using the POST method. This variant allows passing request options in the body for advanced filtering and field selection.

**Prerequisites**
1. **supplierId** - Obtain by creating a supplier via [POST /api/v1.0/suppliers](/docs/api/suppliers/create-supplier), which returns `Item.SupplierId` in the response.

**Workflow Example**
1. Create a new supplier: [POST /api/v1.0/suppliers](/docs/api/suppliers/create-supplier) with required fields â†’ extract `Item.SupplierId`
2. Retrieve supplier with options: [POST /api/v1.0/suppliers/\{supplierId\}](/docs/api/suppliers/get-supplier-by-id-post) with optional request body

**When to Use POST vs GET**: Use the POST variant when you need to pass complex filtering options or specific field selections in the request body. Use GET for simple retrieval without additional options.

**Response**: Returns the full `Supplier` object wrapped in an `ItemGetResponse` envelope with `IsSuccess` and `Item` properties.

<Heading
  id={"request"}
  as={"h2"}
  className={"openapi-tabs__heading"}
  children={"Request"}
>
</Heading>

<ParamsDetails
  parameters={[{"name":"supplierId","in":"path","required":true,"description":"Unique identifier of the supplier.","schema":{"type":"string","format":"uuid"}}]}
>
  
</ParamsDetails>

<RequestSchema
  title={"Body"}
  body={undefined}
>
  
</RequestSchema>
